intro: Sida oxycarpa, commonly known as the sharpleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sida oxycarpa is also known for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
